N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 4.168 - Executive order no. 168: directing the merger of the office of management and productivity into the office of business permits and regulatory assistance

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory

Assistance is making important progress in improving the State's regulatory
structures by reviewing and reforming agency rules and regulatory practices and
simplifying business permit and licensing procedures; WHEREAS, the Office of Management and Productivity is
making measurable improvements in the efficiency and productivity of State
government through a comprehensive management program involving all State
agencies; WHEREAS, both the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory

Assistance and the Office of Management and Productivity share a common
commitment to strengthen and reform the administration of State government so
that it may better serve its citizens; WHEREAS, a merger of the Office of Management and

Productivity into the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory Assistance will
greatly strengthen the State' s efforts and capability to improve productivity, promote regulatory reform, and reduce administrative burdens; WHEREAS, further adjustments may be necessary to fully
effectuate this merger and to carry out an expanded program of government
improvement; NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby merge within the Executive Department the

Office of Management and Productivity into the Office of Business Permits and

Regulatory Assistance. I. Transfer of

Functions, Powers and Duties

Effective April 1, 1993, all of the functions and powers
possessed by, and all of the obligations and duties of, the Office of

Management and Productivity and the Management and Productivity Advisory

Council, as created by Executive Order No. 27 and continued by Executive Order

No. 116, are hereby transferred and assigned to, assumed by and devolved upon
the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory Assistance and the Director
thereof, as may be applicable. The Director of the Office of Business Permits
and Regulatory Assistance shall also be Special Assistant to the Governor for

Regulatory and Management Assistance. II. Transfer of Employees

Consistent with the directive contained in the 1993-94

Executive Budget and in accordance with Civil Service Law § 70 (2), provision shall be made for the transfer of the Office of Management and

Productivity employees who are substantially engaged in the functions being
transferred to the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory Assistance. III. Transfer of Advisory Council

Effective April 1, 1993, the Management and Productivity

Advisory Council established by Executive Order No. 27 and continued by

Executive Order No. 116, including private sector executives and members of the
academic community, is hereby continued and transferred to the Office of

Business Permits and Regulatory Assistance to provide guidance for the
management and productivity activities of the merged offices. Members of the
advisory council shall be appointed by the Governor and serve at his pleasure
for terms of three years. Terms of current members shall be continued as if
appointed on the effective date of this order. They shall serve without salary, but shall be entitled to reimbursement for their necessary and reasonable
expenses incurred in connection with their services to the council. The

Governor shall designate a chairperson from among the council members. IV. Transfer of Pending Projects
and Records

Any matter undertaken or commenced by the Office of

Management and Productivity which is pending on the effective date of the
transfer of functions, powers and duties effected by this order may be
conducted and completed by the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory

Assistance in the same manner and with the same effect as if conducted or
completed by the Office of Management and Productivity. All records in the
possession of the Office of Management and Productivity shall be transferred to
the Office of Business Permits and Regulatory Assistance. V. Continuity of Authority
A. Whenever the Office of Management and

Productivity, its Advisory Council, or the Director thereof is referred to or
designated in any executive order, contract or other document, such reference
or designation shall be deemed to refer to the Office of Business Permits and

Regulatory Assistance or the Director thereof, or the Advisory Council
continued herein, as may be applicable. B. For the purpose of succession to all
functions, powers, duties and obligations transferred and assigned to, devolved
upon and assumed by it pursuant to this order, the Office of Business Permits
and Regulatory Assistance shall constitute the continuation of the Office of

Management and Productivity. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: March 22, 1993
[FN*] [Revoked and superseded by Executive Order No. 20
(George E. Pataki) §
5.20, supra.]
